meanings.definition: A raised road or path across a body of water or wetland.
meanings.sent1: The causeway allowed us to cross the river without getting wet.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen walked along the causeway to reach the other side of the lake.
meanings.sent3: The ducks waddled happily on the causeway, enjoying their own little bridge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a causeway of happiness, spanning across her face.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight reflected on the causeway, creating a magical path over the water.

meanings.sent1: We will causeway the marsh to make it easier for hikers to pass through.
meanings.sent2: The workers causewayed the stream to connect the two parts of the park.
meanings.sent3: The beavers decided to causeway the stream with sticks and mud, much to the surprise of the campers.
meanings.sent4: His words causewayed a path of understanding between the two conflicting parties.
meanings.sent5: The construction crew causewayed the road, ensuring a smooth passage for vehicles.
